summary: Fix skills progress bar animation flickering by ensuring proper initial state management and removing problematic timeout delays. The issue occurs because progress bars don't start at 0% width and the 300ms timeout in animateSkillBar() causes bars to briefly appear at full width before animating, creating a jarring flicker and backward movement effect.

action_plan.description: Update CSS to set initial width of progress bars to 0% and ensure smooth transitions
Modify renderSkills() function to explicitly set initial width of progress bars to 0% when creating skill elements
Fix animateSkillBar() function to remove the 300ms timeout and ensure proper animation sequencing
Update IntersectionObserver logic in addFadeInAnimations() to ensure skill bars are properly initialized before animation triggers
Test the animation fix by loading the skills section and verifying smooth progress bar animations without flickering

risks: Animation timing changes might affect other scroll-based animations
CSS transition modifications could impact performance on slower devices
IntersectionObserver changes might trigger animations too early or late
dependencies: Existing CSS transition system for .skill-progress elements
IntersectionObserver API for scroll-based animation triggers
Current skill data structure in window.STATIC_DATA.skills
issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
